docs.snippet: A scandal engulfing Facebook over the use of its data by political consultants widened on Tuesday when a whistleblower said Canadian company AggregateIQ had developed a program to target Republican voters in the 2016 U.S. election.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Data Scandal Widens as Canadian Company Accused of Helping Target U.S. Voters
headline.main: Facebook Data Scandal Widens as Canadian Company Accused of Helping Target U.S. Voters

docs.snippet: Wall Street closed lower after a rocky session on Wednesday as gains in consumer staples and healthcare were offset by a sharp drop in Amazon shares and a continuing slide in technology stocks.

headline.print_headline: Wall Street Closes Lower in Rocky Session on Amazon Losses
headline.main: Wall Street Closes Lower in Rocky Session on Amazon Losses

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: China, Spotify, Fake News: Your Wednesday Briefing

docs.snippet: The Government Accountability Office found that black students still bear the brunt of school discipline, undermining Trump administration efforts to re-examine Obama-era policies.

headline.print_headline: National Analysis Sees Bias in Discipline
headline.main: Government Watchdog Finds Racial Bias in School Discipline

docs.snippet: The man accused in the slayings of six men at a Quebec City mosque asked for forgiveness Wednesday after changing his mind and pleading guilty.

headline.print_headline: Quebec Mosque Shooting Suspect Changes Mind, Pleads Guilty
headline.main: Quebec Mosque Shooting Suspect Changes Mind, Pleads Guilty

docs.snippet: Facebook is giving its privacy tools a makeover as it reels from criticisms over its data practices and faces tighter European regulations in the coming months.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Revamps Privacy Tools as Tighter EU Rules Draw Near
headline.main: Facebook Revamps Privacy Tools as Tighter EU Rules Draw Near

docs.snippet: In Ms. Nixon’s first trip to Albany as a candidate for governor, she attacked the incumbent, Andrew Cuomo, and the city’s “old boys’ club” atmosphere.

headline.print_headline: Nixon Visits State Capital ‘Mad as Hell’
headline.main: ‘Mad as Hell,’ Cynthia Nixon Comes Out Swinging in Albany

docs.snippet: The envoys met with Kim Jong-un, and the North said they had reached a “satisfactory agreement” about holding an inter-Korean summit meeting.

headline.print_headline: North Korea Praises Talks With Envoys From South
headline.main: North Korea Hails ‘Openhearted Talk’ With South Korean Envoys

docs.snippet: Every marriage has its ups and downs. So New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft urged everyone not to read too much into any reported discord in his organization.

headline.print_headline: Kraft Discounts Any Discord in Patriots Organization
headline.main: Kraft Discounts Any Discord in Patriots Organization
